conclusion: Need to analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph to determine collision time.
Car A starts with a velocity of 25 m/s and Car B starts with a velocity of 15 m/s.
Both cars start braking at the same time and lines intersect at t = 20 s.
Both cars come to a stop at t = 20 s.
Calculate distance traveled by Car A using area under v-t graph: Distance_A = 250 m.
Calculate distance traveled by Car B using area under v-t graph: Distance_B = 150 m.
Car A travels 250 m and Car B travels 150 m.
Collision occurs when distance between cars becomes zero at t = 20 s.
The two cars collide at exactly 20 seconds of braking.
